content.description: This is a cobble clonking climb that follows a flake down low to a long slab finish.
content.location:
It is the next climb right of

By a Thread

.

content.description: Do the same-ish start as the climb to the left. Move right to a reachy but juggy roof move. Finish on yet another long slab. This is a fun route! Perhaps it is a bit harder than the one to the left.
content.location: This is right of center on the slab on the right side of the big-ish roof.

content.description:
This route has the best name at the crag!

Move up and right off chossy ledges. Pull the roof, and get established on the headwall (delicate crux). Once past this, pinch your way up a cruiser slab very similar to the others until you reach the anchors.
content.location: It is right of the roof and angling right to a large groove.

content.description: Like most of the Friends and Family routes, the crux is getting past the steep lower part and getting established on the slab. This crux is a little harder than the others. Some gnarly choss at the top is the reason for the 1 star quality rating. Make sure your belayer uses a helmet! Short folks might think it's harder than .10b or maybe not.
content.location: It is on the right side of the main Friends and Family Wall. There are other climbs to the right. I don't know what these are.

content.description: This is a fun 5.8. Follow a groove to a steep roof. Pull the roof on huge jugs, and finish on a fun, tap-dancing slab. It feels very similar difficulty-wise to the 5.9s on either side to me.
content.location: This is in the middle of the wall at the biggest part of the roof. Follow the groove.

content.description: Considered perhaps the easiest climb on the wall, this pitch starts just left of a blocky, pillar thing. As with most Friends and Family climbs, surmount steeper terrain down low to a long, slabby finish.
content.location:
It is two climbs right of

By a Thread

.

content.description:
This route adds 2 short pitches above

By a Thread

/

Style Man

for a fun 3 pitch sport climbing adventure. The first pitch is a short pitch directly above the

Style Man

anchor to fixed rap anchors on a ledge. The second pitch starts left with aid past 2 bolts (or hard face/slab moves inconsistent with the rest of the route) then continues up the left-facing corner above, exiting right onto a large ledge with rap anchors and plenty of loose rock. This pitch is fairly adventurous for a moderate sport climb.
content.protection: 8 quickdraws, one aider, and a couple of slings worked for the aid climbing bit and were left for the follower to use as well.
content.location:
Above

Style Man

anchor, one 60m rope will get you from the top back to the

Style Man

anchor.

climbs.name: By a Thread
climbs.fa: I believe it was Duane Raleigh on a freesolo

content.description: Finesse through a tricky move off the ground, cruise the middle, and slap your way up a vertical sloper-rail near the end. This is one of my favorite routes of the area.
content.location: This is just right of a large dihedral. It is the leftmost bolted climb on the main face of the Friends and Family Wall.

content.description: Start right of the pillar to a ledge, and pull the roof. Once established on the wall above, another long, pebble-pinching slab awaits.
content.location: It is in the middle of the wall, just right of a pillar/block.
